listing_jobDesc: Read Brenda's story on delivering low-latency, high-throughput systems that improve our connectivity to the financial market. Read Richard's story on navigating the world of automated trading – systems that make trading decisions. Read Marcus's story on working in the risk and treasury team, where he monitors systems that manage and mitigate risk (e.g., trading risk). Read Aidan's story on working in the Compliance IT team, where he manages systems that facilitate reporting and reconciliation. Read Lena's story on production engineering, where she builds tools and systems that enable us to trade smoothly. Keen to create high-performance, low latency designs that critically impact trading success Curious to learn and comfortable discussing/exploring complex technical ideas Have a range of out-of-classroom projects or extra-curricular activities that demonstrates your passion in technology, particularly software development Keen to work alongside the best Developers and Traders in the industry, with the humility to continually upskill and improve yourself Knowledgeable about object orientated design and development concepts (experience with C++, C# or Java is required for our technical assessment) The chance to work alongside diverse, intelligent and driven peers in a rewarding environment We offer competitive remuneration, including: an attractive bonus structure and additional leave entitlements Corporate health insurance Training, mentorship and personal development opportunities Weekly in-house chair massages Daily breakfast and lunch Regular social events including an annual company trip A work-from-home allowance and support. A final year university student or recent graduate Studying a Computer Science, Software/Electrical/Mechatronic Engineering or similarly technical degree

company_offeredRole: Software Development Engineer in Test III - Job Seeker
listing_jobDesc:
Your Job
A Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) at Indeed is a developer with the primary responsibility of building the infrastructure and tooling support to enable SWEs to write test automation. It is a unique and challenging role, and provides immense opportunity to design and develop wide-reaching frameworks and design patterns to enable high velocity code delivery.
Being part of the ACME team you’ll be writing code that automatically verifies the quality of the product. You will be involved in bringing the product from development all the way to production by enhancing, maintaining, and building supportable pipeline enhancements to enable push on green delivery, migrating projects to AWS. This entails creating testing Services/Tools/WebApps that enable others to offer similar support. Drive the strategy for testability of the product with understanding of customer usage models in real-world environments.
SDETs at Indeed are highly skilled engineers who are able to debug code, automate repetitive tasks, and implement/improve tools and frameworks needed to streamline our testing processes. Each SDET has a home base within a development group. Each development group is responsible for one or more products. Being a member of their home team allows SDETS to work directly with other product teams and cross functional roles to understand project features, review technical designs, and implement automated solutions to deliver quality features with efficiency. The potential for impact across the larger technology organization is quite expansive.

At Indeed, we highly value employee career development. SDETs have a clear career path trajectory that can follow technical and managerial paths of growth. Being a key member of a development team as an SDET also provides ample opportunity to grow into different roles throughout the team (such as Software Development Engineer). Cross organizational transfers to work on different projects and technology stacks is also supported and encouraged.
Who You Are
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree or Master's degree with 5+ years of experience as Developer or SDET (Senior QA Automation / Lead).
Strong ability to write effective code utilizing some of the following technologies (Javascript/TS, Java, Spring, Web Services, HTML, XML, AJAX, Microservices, SOA, REST, JSON)
Experience working with AWS, Terraform/CloudFormation
Effective communication across functions to identify tooling needs, automation gaps, and reduce toil in the development process.
Strong experience with Agile development incorporating Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery, utilizing technologies/providers such as Gitlab or Github, Jenkins, Datadog
Debug code, solve complex problems related to efficiency and performance of our software with appropriate production monitoring

Design and Implement new tools, scalable automated test frameworks working across technologies
Strong experience in building development and monitoring tools as an essential part of production system

Mentoring with detailed source code reviews along with technical guidance to overall architecture and design
Strong organizational skills, prioritization and deliverables/results
Able to deal well with ambiguous/undefined problems; ability to think abstractly.
Preferred Qualifications:

Knowledge of functional programming
Docker, Kubernetes, Kafka, RabbitMQ experience

Strong understanding of computer science fundamentals, algorithm design and data structures
Experience in Object Oriented Analysis, Design(OOAD) and development of software using UML Methodology, good knowledge of design patterns
Effectively articulate any technical challenges and undefined problems

Provide innovative solutions related to new tooling and frameworks

Delivering highly customized test assets with mix of tools and techniques to provide a great user experience

Striving for Product scalability, reliability, consistency and performance in Production
AWS Certification
Who we are
We are a rapidly growing and highly-capable Engineering organization building the most popular job site on the planet. With engineering hubs in Seattle, San Francisco, Austin, Tokyo, Singapore, Hyderabad, Dublin, Aberdeen and Vancouver, we are improving people's lives all around the world, one job search at a time.
Our Mission
As the world’s number 1 job site*, our mission is to help people get jobs. We strive to cultivate an inclusive and accessible workplace where all people feel comfortable being themselves. We're looking to grow our teams with more people who share our enthusiasm for innovation and creating the best experience for job seekers.
(*comScore Total Visits, September 2021)
Salary Range Disclaimer
The base salary range represents the low and high end of the Indeed salary range for this position. Actual salaries will vary depending on factors including but not limited to location, experience, and performance. The range listed is just one component of Indeed's total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include quarterly bonuses, Restricted Stock Units (RSUs), an open Paid Time Off policy, and many region-specific benefits.
Salary Range Transparency
Tokyo 16,330,000 - 23,670,000 JPY per year
Equal Opportunities and Accommodations Statement
Indeed is deeply committed to creating a workplace and global community where inclusion is not only valued, but prioritized. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, family status, marital status, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, neurodiversity, disability, age, or any other non-merit based or legally protected grounds.

Indeed is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities in the employment application process. To request an accommodation, please contact Talent Attraction Help at +81 3 4563 2563, or by email at TAhelp@indeed.com at least one week in advance of your interview.
Our Policies and Benefits
View Indeed's Applicant Privacy and Accessibility Policies - https://www.indeed.com/legal/indeed-jobs
Learn about our global employee perks, programs and benefits - https://benefits.indeed.jobs/

You can concisely describe your ideas in written form, and quickly put together proofs of concept. 
Excel in a work environment that is mostly asynchronous (writing, messaging, videos). 
Have a passion for infrastructure, and keep yourself up to date with advances in the industry. 
Thrive in ambiguity and can charter your own path. 
You’re energized to learn and apply new technologies and skills.

Equity package with friendly terms intended to become life-changing for early team members. 
Fully remote with flexible hours wherever you call home, although we ask that your workday overlaps at least four hours with CET. Equipment budget for your home office. 
25 days PTO, health benefits, and pension account with full employer match. 
We pride ourselves in being a small team that can achieve beyond what’s usually expected for our numbers. 
We balance our long-term vision with short-term pragmatism. 
We believe in being fully transparent internally on how decisions are made, on how the company is doing, and we use that information to drive our decisions.

Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) is a suite of products that provides build and deploy tooling for Engineers in the firm. It provides a modern, secure and highly available plant that facilitates source control, code review, build, test and production activation.
 Distributed Scheduling (Runtime) offers scalable, highly available and efficient platforms and services for job scheduling, grid computing, Compute-as-a-Service, file transfer and software distribution across the firm.
 Build / Development
GitLab - The firm's strategic vendor CI/CD platform, hosted in-house with instances on-prem and on public cloud.
Proprietary SDLC, based on Subversion for source control to facilitate workflow and approvals around building and deploying software.
In-house developed Configuration Database (CD) tools for deploying Software packages, config and Infrastructure as Code.
SecDb ecosystem - Proprietary securities language used in SecDb, Java / Scala monorepo that integrates with Slang and SecDb, CI/CD platform for the C++ / Java of SecDb and non-SecDb teams.
 GitLab - The firm's strategic vendor CI/CD platform, hosted in-house with instances on-prem and on public cloud.

 Distribution - Linux and Windows software distribution system used by Gitlab, Conductor Software Factory and Train.
 Artifact Repository - Primary build artifact repository hosting terabytes of internal and external software packages and industry standard asset repos such as Mavern Central, NPMScopes and PyPi, running on Sonatype Nexus.
 Job / Task Scheduling - Large scale, multi-tenant cross platform distributed computing system running batch workflows.
 Grid Compute - Grid compute for Slang and JSI workloads, used for risk and pricing calculations.
 Stateless Compute - Cluster manager that interfaces with Job Schedulers to schedule stateless jobs on shared pool of managed compute.
 File Transfer - Managed file transfer with external clients.

company_offeredRole: Software Development Engineer in Test III - Job Seeker
listing_jobDesc:
Your Job
A Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) at Indeed is a developer with the primary responsibility of building the infrastructure and tooling support to enable SWEs to write test automation. It is a unique and challenging role, and provides immense opportunity to design and develop wide-reaching frameworks and design patterns to enable high velocity code delivery.
Being part of the ACME team you’ll be writing code that automatically verifies the quality of the product. You will be involved in bringing the product from development all the way to production by enhancing, maintaining, and building supportable pipeline enhancements to enable push on green delivery, migrating projects to AWS. This entails creating testing Services/Tools/WebApps that enable others to offer similar support. Drive the strategy for testability of the product with understanding of customer usage models in real-world environments.
SDETs at Indeed are highly skilled engineers who are able to debug code, automate repetitive tasks, and implement/improve tools and frameworks needed to streamline our testing processes. Each SDET has a home base within a development group. Each development group is responsible for one or more products. Being a member of their home team allows SDETS to work directly with other product teams and cross functional roles to understand project features, review technical designs, and implement automated solutions to deliver quality features with efficiency. The potential for impact across the larger technology organization is quite expansive.

At Indeed, we highly value employee career development. SDETs have a clear career path trajectory that can follow technical and managerial paths of growth. Being a key member of a development team as an SDET also provides ample opportunity to grow into different roles throughout the team (such as Software Development Engineer). Cross organizational transfers to work on different projects and technology stacks is also supported and encouraged.
Who You Are
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree or Master's degree with 5+ years of experience as Developer or SDET (Senior QA Automation / Lead).
Strong ability to write effective code utilizing some of the following technologies (Javascript/TS, Java, Spring, Web Services, HTML, XML, AJAX, Microservices, SOA, REST, JSON)
Experience working with AWS, Terraform/CloudFormation
Effective communication across functions to identify tooling needs, automation gaps, and reduce toil in the development process.
Strong experience with Agile development incorporating Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery, utilizing technologies/providers such as Gitlab or Github, Jenkins, Datadog
Debug code, solve complex problems related to efficiency and performance of our software with appropriate production monitoring

Design and Implement new tools, scalable automated test frameworks working across technologies
Strong experience in building development and monitoring tools as an essential part of production system

Mentoring with detailed source code reviews along with technical guidance to overall architecture and design
Strong organizational skills, prioritization and deliverables/results
Able to deal well with ambiguous/undefined problems; ability to think abstractly.
Preferred Qualifications:

Knowledge of functional programming
Docker, Kubernetes, Kafka, RabbitMQ experience

Strong understanding of computer science fundamentals, algorithm design and data structures
Experience in Object Oriented Analysis, Design(OOAD) and development of software using UML Methodology, good knowledge of design patterns
Effectively articulate any technical challenges and undefined problems

Provide innovative solutions related to new tooling and frameworks

Delivering highly customized test assets with mix of tools and techniques to provide a great user experience

Striving for Product scalability, reliability, consistency and performance in Production
AWS Certification
Who we are
We are a rapidly growing and highly-capable Engineering organization building the most popular job site on the planet. With engineering hubs in Seattle, San Francisco, Austin, Tokyo, Singapore, Hyderabad, Dublin, Aberdeen and Vancouver, we are improving people's lives all around the world, one job search at a time.
Our Mission
As the world’s number 1 job site*, our mission is to help people get jobs. We strive to cultivate an inclusive and accessible workplace where all people feel comfortable being themselves. We're looking to grow our teams with more people who share our enthusiasm for innovation and creating the best experience for job seekers.
(*comScore Total Visits, September 2021)
Salary Range Disclaimer
The base salary range represents the low and high end of the Indeed salary range for this position. Actual salaries will vary depending on factors including but not limited to location, experience, and performance. The range listed is just one component of Indeed's total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include quarterly bonuses, Restricted Stock Units (RSUs), an open Paid Time Off policy, and many region-specific benefits.
Salary Range Transparency
Tokyo 16,330,000 - 23,670,000 JPY per year
Equal Opportunities and Accommodations Statement
Indeed is deeply committed to creating a workplace and global community where inclusion is not only valued, but prioritized. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, family status, marital status, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, neurodiversity, disability, age, or any other non-merit based or legally protected grounds.

Indeed is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities in the employment application process. To request an accommodation, please contact Talent Attraction Help at +81 3 4563 2563, or by email at TAhelp@indeed.com at least one week in advance of your interview.
Our Policies and Benefits
View Indeed's Applicant Privacy and Accessibility Policies - https://www.indeed.com/legal/indeed-jobs
Learn about our global employee perks, programs and benefits - https://benefits.indeed.jobs/

company_offeredRole: Software Development Engineer in Test III - Job Seeker
listing_jobDesc:
Your Job
A Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) at Indeed is a developer with the primary responsibility of building the infrastructure and tooling support to enable SWEs to write test automation. It is a unique and challenging role, and provides immense opportunity to design and develop wide-reaching frameworks and design patterns to enable high velocity code delivery.
Being part of the ACME team you’ll be writing code that automatically verifies the quality of the product. You will be involved in bringing the product from development all the way to production by enhancing, maintaining, and building supportable pipeline enhancements to enable push on green delivery, migrating projects to AWS. This entails creating testing Services/Tools/WebApps that enable others to offer similar support. Drive the strategy for testability of the product with understanding of customer usage models in real-world environments.
SDETs at Indeed are highly skilled engineers who are able to debug code, automate repetitive tasks, and implement/improve tools and frameworks needed to streamline our testing processes. Each SDET has a home base within a development group. Each development group is responsible for one or more products. Being a member of their home team allows SDETS to work directly with other product teams and cross functional roles to understand project features, review technical designs, and implement automated solutions to deliver quality features with efficiency. The potential for impact across the larger technology organization is quite expansive.

At Indeed, we highly value employee career development. SDETs have a clear career path trajectory that can follow technical and managerial paths of growth. Being a key member of a development team as an SDET also provides ample opportunity to grow into different roles throughout the team (such as Software Development Engineer). Cross organizational transfers to work on different projects and technology stacks is also supported and encouraged.
Who You Are
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree or Master's degree with 5+ years of experience as Developer or SDET (Senior QA Automation / Lead).
Strong ability to write effective code utilizing some of the following technologies (Javascript/TS, Java, Spring, Web Services, HTML, XML, AJAX, Microservices, SOA, REST, JSON)
Experience working with AWS, Terraform/CloudFormation
Effective communication across functions to identify tooling needs, automation gaps, and reduce toil in the development process.
Strong experience with Agile development incorporating Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery, utilizing technologies/providers such as Gitlab or Github, Jenkins, Datadog
Debug code, solve complex problems related to efficiency and performance of our software with appropriate production monitoring

Design and Implement new tools, scalable automated test frameworks working across technologies
Strong experience in building development and monitoring tools as an essential part of production system

Mentoring with detailed source code reviews along with technical guidance to overall architecture and design
Strong organizational skills, prioritization and deliverables/results
Able to deal well with ambiguous/undefined problems; ability to think abstractly.
Preferred Qualifications:

Knowledge of functional programming
Docker, Kubernetes, Kafka, RabbitMQ experience

Strong understanding of computer science fundamentals, algorithm design and data structures
Experience in Object Oriented Analysis, Design(OOAD) and development of software using UML Methodology, good knowledge of design patterns
Effectively articulate any technical challenges and undefined problems

Provide innovative solutions related to new tooling and frameworks

Delivering highly customized test assets with mix of tools and techniques to provide a great user experience

Striving for Product scalability, reliability, consistency and performance in Production
AWS Certification
Who we are
We are a rapidly growing and highly-capable Engineering organization building the most popular job site on the planet. With engineering hubs in Seattle, San Francisco, Austin, Tokyo, Singapore, Hyderabad, Dublin, Aberdeen and Vancouver, we are improving people's lives all around the world, one job search at a time.
Our Mission
As the world’s number 1 job site*, our mission is to help people get jobs. We strive to cultivate an inclusive and accessible workplace where all people feel comfortable being themselves. We're looking to grow our teams with more people who share our enthusiasm for innovation and creating the best experience for job seekers.
(*comScore Total Visits, September 2021)
Salary Range Disclaimer
The base salary range represents the low and high end of the Indeed salary range for this position. Actual salaries will vary depending on factors including but not limited to location, experience, and performance. The range listed is just one component of Indeed's total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include quarterly bonuses, Restricted Stock Units (RSUs), an open Paid Time Off policy, and many region-specific benefits.
Salary Range Transparency
Tokyo 16,330,000 - 23,670,000 JPY per year
Equal Opportunities and Accommodations Statement
Indeed is deeply committed to creating a workplace and global community where inclusion is not only valued, but prioritized. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, family status, marital status, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, neurodiversity, disability, age, or any other non-merit based or legally protected grounds.

Indeed is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities in the employment application process. To request an accommodation, please contact Talent Attraction Help at +81 3 4563 2563, or by email at TAhelp@indeed.com at least one week in advance of your interview.
